intro: Paronychia chlorothyrsa var. erythraea, commonly known as the red-sepal paronychia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers with distinctive red sepals. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its botanical characteristics make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
